Since usernames tested did not reveal any username enumeration, I will try to brute-force passwords for the username "root" since it is a common default user for SSH.

I will use hydra to perform a brute-force attack on SSH port 2288 using a small common password list (e.g., rockyou.txt top 100).

Command:
hydra -l root -P /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt -s 2288 -t 4 ssh://172.10.0.3 -o hydra_ssh_results.txt -V -q

This will attempt passwords for root user on SSH port 2288 with 4 parallel threads. Output will be saved to file and verbose turned off to reduce clutter.
